Method Detail

getAnalyzeCommands

public static java.lang.String getAnalyzeCommands(GtpClientBase gtp)
Query analyze commands configuration from the program. Sends the command gogui-analyze_commands (or gogui_analyze_commands as used by older versions of GoGui, if the program does not support the new command). Note: call GtpClientBase.querySupportedCommands() first.

Returns:
The response to gogui-analyze_commands or null, if this command is not supported or returns an error.

getPlaySequenceCommand

public static java.lang.String getPlaySequenceCommand(GtpClientBase gtp,
                                                      java.util.ArrayList<Move> moves)
Construct a gogui-play_sequence command from a list of moves.

getPlaySequenceCommand

public static java.lang.String getPlaySequenceCommand(GtpClientBase gtp)

getTitle

public static java.lang.String getTitle(GtpClientBase gtp)
Get title for current game from program. Uses gogui-title (see GoGui documentation) or the deprectated command gogui_title. Note: call GtpClientBase.querySupportedCommands() first.

Returns:
The response to the command or null, if neither command is supported or the command failed.

isPlaySequenceSupported

public static boolean isPlaySequenceSupported(GtpClientBase gtp)

saveParameters

public static void saveParameters(GtpClientBase gtp,
                                  java.util.ArrayList<AnalyzeDefinition> analyzeCommands,
                                  java.io.File file)
                           throws ErrorMessage
Save parameters to a GTP file. Sends all analyze commands of type "param" to the program to query the current parameter values and creates a config file with GTP commands that allows to restore the values.

Parameters:
gtp - The GTP connection.
analyzeCommands - The analyze command definitions for this program (e.g. from AnalyzeDefinition.read()).
Throws:
ErrorMessage - If writing the file fails or none of the analyze commands have the type "param" (error responses from the program are written in comment lines in the resulting file). See GoGui documentation, chapter "Analyze Commands"
